intro: Jaeschkea canaliculata, commonly known as the narrow-ribbed lichen, is a species of lichen that belongs to the family Lecanoraceae. It is characterized by its foliose thallus with distinct, elongated lobes and a pale to dark yellowish-green color. The plant forms a symbiotic relationship between a fungus and an alga, with the algal partner providing nutrients through photosynthesis. It typically grows on tree trunks and branches in cool, moist forest environments. Jaeschkea canaliculata is often found in temperate regions and is used as an indicator species for environmental conditions.
